definitions.definition: To coat with a layer of metal by electrochemical means.

subdefinitions.definition: To coat with a layer of zinc (for rust resistance) by electrochemical means.
examples: We then galvanize the steel so that the zinc coating will sacrificially take the corrosion for many years.

definitions.definition: To shock or stimulate into sudden activity, as if by electric shock .
examples: The girl’s picture helped galvanize public opinion against the administration’s policy.
Republicans are hoping a proposed gas-tax repeal will galvanize their voters.

definitions.definition: To switch sides between Union and Confederate in the American Civil War .

main_definition: ( loosely , dated ) To coat with a layer of metal by electrochemical means.
secondary_definitions: ( figurative ) To shock or stimulate into sudden activity, as if by electric shock .
( archaic ) To electrify , as by galvanism .
( historical , US ) To switch sides between Union and Confederate in the American Civil War .
